ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Loss of appetite._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.: The process of taking in a substance, especially by eating or drinking, or the quantities thereof; admittance of people to a place or organization at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Total parenteral nutrition formulated for intravenous administration in patients who cannot eat or cannot get enough nutrients from the foods they eat.  It is a liquid mixture of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals and other nutrients.

Concepts.definition: Total parenteral nutrition formulated for intravenous administration in patients who cannot eat or cannot get enough nutrients from the foods they eat.  It is a liquid mixture of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals and other nutrients.

PermissibleValues.value: Able to eat and drink; reasonable intake

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having no exceptional quality or ability.: A group of substances which are consumed by humans and animals.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A single serving of a beverage; any liquid suitable for drinking.: The process of taking in a substance, especially by eating or drinking, or the quantities thereof; admittance of people to a place or organization at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Having no exceptional quality or ability.
A group of materials of either plant, animal or artificial origin containing essential body nutrients that can be ingested by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and maintain life.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A single serving of a beverage; any liquid suitable for drinking.
The process of taking in a substance, especially by eating or drinking, or the quantities thereof; admittance of people to a place or organization at a particular time.

PermissibleValues.value: Significantly decreased intake, but able to eat
